intro: Schoenoplectus × carinatus, commonly known as the common reed, is a hybrid plant species belonging to the family Cyperaceae. It is a tall, perennial grass-like plant that typically grows in wetland environments such as marshes, ponds, and along the edges of lakes. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces dense clusters of small, spike-like flowers that are usually greenish or brownish in color. It plays an important ecological role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for various aquatic and terrestrial organisms. Schoenoplectus × carinatus is widely distributed across temperate regions of the Northern Hemisphere.
